schemaMeta.comments: ![Moodle Logo](https://examulator.com/er/icons/Moodle-icon_30.png) The Moodle Database is complex. Normal installation discards Primary/Foreign Keys and field comments. These diagrams restore that data

table.name: adminpresets
table.comments: named sets of site wide configurations e.g. enable/disable features https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CyNOhbJ76fY

table.name: user
table.comments: One record for each person, custom profile fields can be added via /user/profile/index.php for sample reports see https://docs.moodle.org/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#USER_and_ENROLMENT_Reports

column.name: password
column.comments: stored as a hash, for authentication the password is hashed and compared with this

column.name: mnethostid
column.comments: mainly used for connecting to the Mahara e-portfolio system https://mahara.org/

column.name: auth
column.comments: The authorisation system used by this account, e.g. Oauth2 or manual https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Authentication_plugins

column.name: deleted
column.comments: always check for deleted=0 when looking for non deleted accounts

column.name: policyagreed
column.comments: User has agreed to system policies. https://github.com/moodle/moodle/tree/master/admin/tool/policy

column.name: firstlogin
column.comments: Unix timetamp first time ever this user logged in

column.name: currentlogin
column.comments: Unix timetamp for start of current login

table.name: forum
table.comments: Forum discussion system. For sample reports see https://docs.moodle.org/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#Forum_Activity

column.name: assessed
column.comments: Rating aggregate type can be: average, count, maximum, minimum, sum. As integers

table.name: files
table.comments: description of files, content is stored in sha1 file pool meaning no duplicate storage https://docs.moodle.org/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#List_course_resources_accumulative_file_size_and_count

table.name: survey
table.comments: Each record is one SURVEY module with its configuration, https://docs.moodle.org/en/Survey_activity

table.name: assign
table.comments: This table saves information about an instance of mod_assign in a course. For sample reports see https://docs.moodle.org/401/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#Assignment_Activity

column.name: parent
column.comments: if bigger than 0 this is a (hidden) subquesiton, used by Cloze

column.name: status
column.comments: The status of the assessment. By default the instance is under-assessment state see https://moodledev.io/docs/apis/core/grading#grading-form-instance

table.name: quiz
table.comments: The settings for each quiz. For reports see https://docs.moodle.org/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#Quiz_Activity

column.name: completionminattempts
column.comments: complete after minimum number of attempts

table.name: course
table.comments: Central course table. For reports see https://docs.moodle.org/en/ad-hoc_contributed_reports#COURSE_REPORTS

column.name: showreports
column.comments: can a student view their own activity reports via their profile page

column.name: marker
column.comments: marks a topic as highlighted, only one topic can be highlighted at a time

column.name: newsitems
column.comments: count of announcements in latest announcments block

column.name: maxbytes
column.comments: largest file that can be uploaded to the course

table.name: question_attempts
table.comments: Each row here corresponds to an attempt at one question, as part of a question_usage. A question_attempt will have some question_attempt_steps For documentation https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Overview_of_the_Moodle_question_engine
